Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Un addon à Half-Life. Autant Blue Shift est très moyen, autant j'ai trouvé Opposing Force très bien ! Je le mettrai juste un poil en dessous de Half-Life. On voit une autre partie de l'histoire qui se déroule en parallèle, et le gameplay est toujours aussi bon, même si un poil différent vu qu'on ne dispose pas des mêmes armes.

[h1]Rejouabilité, achievements[/h1]

Non, pas vraiment de rejouabilité, et aucun achievement.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Si vous avez aimé Half-Life, foncez. Recommandé.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente. Je n'ai rencontré aucun problème et le jeu tourne au poil sur ma machine.

OS: Linux Mint 16 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i5 3570K OC@4.5Ghz, Nvidia 670GTX, 16GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, configurés en screens X séparés.

Это глобальное дополнение для Half-Life 1, имеющее массу преимуществ в виде большого количества вооружения, и персонажей.
-Графика такая как и в оригинале, особо изменений не было. Добавлены материалы и текстуры другие. 
-Здесь гораздо веселее чем в оригинальном Half-Life. Новый режим Multiplayer, где есть режим "Захват Флага".
Уверен что запомнился Opposing Force людям, пистолет - Заряжается бесконечно.

Adds so many new weapons and gameplay features. Great half life expansion

Half Life Opposing Force is a side story where you play as Shepard, a high ranking officer sent into Black Mesa to rescue scientists but have your chopper shot down by Zen aircraft. 

The story for Opposing Force is nothing to write home about as it's more shallow than Half Life 2's :Lost Coast level. However it's excusable as the gameplay is what holds it together. Compared to the original Half Life. Opposing Force adds more ways for units that tag along with you to help out, and it also adds more weapons to use. You will still be at home with the fast Half Life gameplay but now with LMG's and some new Zen weapons that add to the momentum based combat. It also adds more enemy Archetypes to fight against later in the game that require you to think some of your movements out a little more instead of just b-hopping everywhere. It's nothing that stands out too much but is a good play through if you already enjoyed Half Life 1's mechanics but wanted more Black Mesa and less Zen.

HalfLife Opposing Force brings the has much action and problem solving challenges as HalfLife, but if you're a fan of HalfLife then you'll enjoy being on the other side of the story, and find the exquisite moments where both storylines touch very entertaining. The fact that you're a marine, does bring more group effort, when you join your fellow marines against the black ops teams or alien invaders, something that you did little on HalfLife. 
After playing HalfLife Blueshit, I was not expecting a full lenght game, so I was suprised when the Opposing Force took much longer to finish.
Being a Mac user, I did bumped into the nasty final boss programming bug, where the Gene Worm disappears, and you were not teleported out of the room. This is a known bug since at least 2013, so it could have been fixed by Valve already.
Overall, for a HalfLife fan, this was very entertaining, at the same level of expectations as HalfLife.

This "Extension Pack" adds a lot to the half-life universe,
and I really think that it is an interesting idea to play from the 'bad guys' perspective!
if you are wondering if you should buy this Extension Pack, I would say yes and here are some reasons why you should:

Weapons almost perfectly one (9/10)
- This extension pack adds lots of new weapons that are fun to use!
- The textures, sounds, and model make the weapons look and feel extra good!
- I really wish they had these weapons in the original Half-Life or in future Half-Life games.

Puzzles are not too difficult nor simple (9/10)
- The puzzles in this game are challenging but not going too far!
- They are a big part of the game, and they where made very well!

Atmosphere awesome like in the first game (9/10)
- I really liked the style and feel of this game!
- The textures, sounds and maps are well put together,
nothing seems out of place!

Enemies/NPCs are very interesting (8/10)
- This game adds really cool new Enemies and NPCs!
- The new enemies are challenging and are a refresh to the gameplay!
- The new NPCs are awesome and fun to interact with!
basically another refresher for the gameplay!

Sounds are well designed (8/10)
- Even the new sounds are really good and high quality for it's time.
- This game's sounds are easily recognizable which is a good thing!

Gameplay is awesome (8/10)
- I really like the movement in this game! (for new players it would not be the most comfortable system)
- I really liked also the rope claiming thingy they added
- And I enjoyed going through the Boot Camp (The Tutorial)
- The paste of this game is hella fun!
- The new enemies, weapons and features are really made well!

Textures are well made for their time (7/10)
- This game's graphics are not the photorealistic graphics of today, but even today the look nice and have a really nice 'atmosphere' in them.
- Even the newer graphics that this extension pack added don't look out of place, well done!

AI is smart and enjoyable (7/10)
- Sometimes the AI feels a bit too strong and at times too weak.
- The enemies take cover and try to hide when hurt.
- NPCs know when to take risks and when its too much for them.
- The enemy AI is challenging and really well made!

Thank you for reading my review!
My final score for this Extension Pack would be a solid (8/10)

A great continuation of one small push forward, you walk the steps of the people you fought against before.

Opposing Force tells the story of what happens during the Black Mesa incident and what became after Gordon Freeman's involvment(cameo included). As one of the many soldiers sent to silence the people responsible, you must make your way through the facility and salvage any survivors be it scientist or soldier. There are new questions answered, and more to follow that may never be solved.

10/10 New Sight, New Story.

Half-Life: Opposing Force ist ein verdammt langweiliger DLC.

Die Grafik ist genau gleich geblieben wie bei dem Hauptspiel Half-Life. Immer noch recht ahnsehnlich aber klar schon etwas in die Jahre gekommen aber das stört mich nicht.

Das Gameplay ist eigentlich wie bei Half-Life, aber ich weiss auch nicht ich fand es einfach viel zu kurz und an sich geht das Spiel nur ganz schleppend voran. Da ist das Hauptspiel aus meiner Sicht wesentlich besser! Auch allgemein die Story fand ich irgend wie ziemlich flach und auch nicht wirklich durchdacht. 

Alles in allem fand Half-Life: Opposing Force nicht so gut wie das eigentliche Hauptspiel, aber es gehört einfach zu dem Franchise dazu man sollte es gespielt haben, aber naja mir gefiehl es nicht.

Muito interessante! Se já jogas-te o [url=store.steampowered.com/app/70/HalfLife/]Half-Life 1[/url] e queres saber um bocadinho mais desta grande saga, esta pequena sequela é uma boa maneira de "apimentar" a história de [url=store.steampowered.com/bundle/231/HalfLife_Complete/]Half-Life[/url], sendo o protagonista um militar e não o típico Gordon Freeman. Este militar tem como missão matar todas as testemunhas do acidente em Black Mesa, mas isso não sognifica que ele assim o faça. Esta pequena sequela não é uma parte da história essencial nem obrigatória para ficar a perceber a história de [url=store.steampowered.com/bundle/231/HalfLife_Complete/]Half-Life[/url], mas é uma boa adição aos conhecimentos sobre [url=store.steampowered.com/bundle/231/HalfLife_Complete/]Half-Life[/url] :)
Aconselho-te bastante a comprar, principalmente se gostares de [url=store.steampowered.com/bundle/231/HalfLife_Complete/]Half-Life[/url].

Now, when I got your attention, let's write a proper review. It is my very first one, so please be kind to me :D 

Simply a great addition to Half-Life franchise with good story. The look from the other side of the conflict is something what should be interesting, right? It is, however in the end you just basically fight for your life against alliens and black-ops, but the atmosphere of catching Freeeman is still there, which is great. Gameplay is good (I thought the campaign was longer, but I have finished it under 6 hours), we have a bunch of new weapons with pretty neat functions (that desert eagle with laser sights is my favourite and machine gun with its kickback is crazy), alien weapons are good too, level architecture is really nice and we have a few new enemies and bosses. Lot of new atractive enviroments - biodomes, testing areas, biolabs, exteriors in desert and even the training mission was fun. Ropes adds a new feature to the gameplay, however they are not used really extensively (and the last one was buggy as hell, I was always  magically stucked on the wall for some unknown reason). However this is great game, im still faving fun playing after nearly 19 years.
This is by far my favorite Half-Life game, hell its better than Half-Life 1.
One of the finest single player FPS experiences ever made!

Opposing Force is a great example why I will always prefer the expansion pack method of adding content to a game over DLC or micro transactions. This game is arguably even better than the original Half-Life in a lot of aspects and in any discussion about Half-Life you will have people who will list this as their all time favorite Half-Life game. It's for a good reason obviously considering how much the game expands upon the formula and mechanics of the first Half-Life. 

The game introduces a ton of new content in all aspects. You have a new alien faction known as "race-x" that ramps up the difficulty and challenge in the game a ton and in general this game is quite a bit harder than the original Half-Life so I recommend playing it AFTER you complete the original Half-Life, while the game starts out with just normal Xen enemies once the race-x dudes start showing up you are going to realize how dangerous things have gotten when your trapped in a sewer with the big race-x dudes who shoot giant fucking death balls at you that can kill instantly if you are in the direct way of the ball. The game also expands upon the "black-ops" by making them a separate faction from HECU and adding appropriate units to replace what would be marine enemies in the original Half-Life. There is also a great number of more companians available to the player including medic's which in addition to being capable of firing back at the enemy also can heal the player and other friendly units, you have engineers who can cut through doors with their blow torch, and of course just normal grunts who dont have any special ability's per say but usually come with a pretty good weapon like a shotgun or assault rifle. You also have a new security guard in addition to your normal Barney's who's called "Otis" and he is a pretty amusing and interesting character to have and, again, spices up the content by adding more variety. 

The arsenal the player is capable of carrying has been drastically expanded upon including two different melee weapons in place of half-life 1's single melee weapon and multiple alien and experimental weapons. A big stand out to me was the teleporter gun which can one hit "kill" an enemy by essentially teleporting him to a random location presumably somewhere in Xen, but the secondary fire will teleport you yourself to a random location in Xen that can only be accessed in that way and often contains many resources and a teleport on the other side which will get you back into black mesa at a fixed position that is usually later in the level, which is interesting because it essentially allows you to skip whole parts of levels as long as you have the ammo to utilize the alt-fire. There is also a barnacle weapon which the player can use to grapple across gaps and walls at points as well as latch on to enemies and pull it into its maw which the barnacle will proceed to devour, really creative and diverse weapons loadout for sure. 

The story adds a lot of interesting new lore to the Half-Life story besides just a new alien race by clarifying on the relationship between the soldiers and the black-ops and a pretty disturbing plot point of what happens to the marines who fail to evacuate or are left behind after the order to pull out comes out. It also expands on the character of the G-man giving new insight into his "personality" and actions as well as expanding on the ending to half-life by showing what happens to black mesa itself after everything is said and done. 

The multiplayer has also been expanded upon with many maps and game-modes that the original Half-Life simply does not have. 

The only bad part of playing this thing is after playing such an awesome game your going to be tempted to recall the current state of gearbox software and feel a bit of despair at the whole thing. Its like if somebody who you like and highly respected joined a skinhead gang, became a gay prostitute and contracted aids and than went around snorting cocaine and beating up homeless people and stray dogs and puppy's before shooting up an old folks home before blowing himself up and screaming "hail Satan" as his last words. Maybe a bit dramatic but seriously dude, what a fall from grace.
"Well, the pilot thought we were headin' to your mother's house, heh. So far this all looks familiar."

[b]+[/b] When I play this game, I feel like playing a familiar game with an entirely fresh experience. Immersive, interactive, destructive, physically correct, and grotesquely violent, [i]Opposing Force[/i] ensures a quality game of [i]Half-Life[/i] as a reality.
[b]+[/b] Gordon could break boxes with the crowbar, but Adrian Shephard can turn Headcrabs (amongst other small creatures) into a splat of guts with the powerful strike of a wrench. The player gets a thorough story of a tale of one soldier of the Opposing Force who finds himself to be fighting for survival, and while the secondary characters that tell the dialogue are still designed to be "there and done", the exchange of conversation and dialogue has notably been improved.
[b]+[/b] Graphics are equally beautiful as the original, and the level design is agreeable and additionally, thanks to the utilization of some of the additions of new content, has some of the trickiest and most well-planned level architectures and puzzles ever.
[b]+[/b] For an expansion pack, we got an abundance of new weapons (up to 23 according to the game files and in multiplayer compared to the original's 14--with 5 being entirely new weapons and 4 essentially being re-editions--though there are only 17 in single-player), enemies, personnel with their own abilities for helping the player, and ways of physically interacting with the world, notably the climbing of ropes, which I find to be among the most pleasing additions to the game. Gearbox obviously tried so hard to make the game not feel too familiar to the original that they would add the new stuff and replace some content with better versions. The Barnacle as a weapon is a very special surprise to me, we have teleporting guns, there are replacements such as the revolver being placed by the more-functional Desert Eagle, and we are fighting primarily against a race of aliens known as Race X, comprising species other than those in the original game, not to mention that the flashlight has been replaced by night vision.
[b]+[/b] As a bonus for enthusiasts of multiplayer, functionality is expanded to not only include Deathmatch as in the original [i]Half-Life[/i] as well as additional levels, but Capture the Flag as well.
[b]-[/b] Sadly, there are cases where there are under-demonstrations of the improvements such as the ropes as well as over-demonstration of certain improvements at a time that can render the game a bit repetitive, specifically late in it. I have had a lot of fun with the improvements, but with about 7 hours of campaign, I am left disappointed with the feeling of missing out on the full potential.

[b]CONCLUSION:[/b] [i]Half-Life: Opposing Force[/i] offers ideas that further demonstrate the capabilities of the GoldSrc engine and successfully build on the original game, in the same way that made the original popular to begin with.

[b]SCORE: 90%[/b]
It's ok.

Жду Half-Life: Opposing Force 2

Игра хоть и является обычным аддоном для культовой игры, но сомневаюсь, что у OF меньше фанатов чем у HL.
Gearbox сделали нам Blue Shift и Decay, где мы играем за работников Black Mesa. А вот Opposing Force показывает нам совершенно новую историю за тех, кого мы считали врагами: Солдата HECU, Капрала Адриана Шепарда.
Герои всё тех же Blue Shift и Decay просто сбежали из комплекса и Барни вернётся только в HL2, но Адриан был даже лучше Гордона. Если Гордона G-Man принял на работу, то от Адриана он хотел избавиться. Жаль, что нам не говорят, что с ним случилось. Хотелось бы получить официальное продолжение истории. 
Объект: Адриан Шепард
Состояние: Ждёт второго прихода

A very interesting game that puts you in the shoes of the bad guys. You have the HECU fighting the Black Ops fighting the Xen creatures fighting a new alien race unseen in half life 1. It's a real shame Shepard hasn't been seen in an official valve game since.
It's Half-Life One with more wepons, aliens, and all around fun!

Half life dan daha çok sevdiğim oyundur kendisi. 2000 yılında internet cafede bolca oynardık. demise mapının benm nazarımda ayrı yeri vardır. Half life daki crossfire gibi. Gel gelelim şuanki duruma, bu oyun hala half life kullanıcıları arasında pek bilinmiyor ve popüler olmadığı için online oyuncu ve server sayısı çok az olduğu için ne yazık ki geri iade etmek durumunda kaldım.
I like that game

Bu sefer olayları Adrian Shepard'ın gözünden yani ordudaki bir onbaşı olarak görüyoruz. Bol silah ve düşman çeşitliliğinin yanı sıra hiçte fena olmayan bir hikayesi var. Gordon Freeman'ı Xen Boyutuna geçmek için portala atlarken görebiliyoruz.
Hatta portalın içine atlayıp Xen'e Gordon Freeman ile gidebiliyoruz ama bir tür paradoks oluşturuyoruz ve oyun en son oluşturulan save dosyasından oyunu başlatıyor.  Gordon Freeman'ı yakalamaya çalışan askeri timin bir üyesiyiz fakat bir sorun çıkıyor ve Gordon Freeman yerine Xen'den gelen yaratıkları avlıyoruz. Multiplayerı asıl Half-Life oyununun multiplayerına benziyor tabii ki daha fazla silah çeşitliliği ile bir fark yaratıyor.  
8/10
